title: How People Scan Pages Before They Read
subtitle: Usability research shows approximately 80% of users scan pages rather than reading word-by-word. Understanding these patterns helps structure resumes for the human eye.

studySnapshot.whatItStudied: How people visually scan pages before deciding to read in depth
studySnapshot.sample: Multiple studies across thousands of participants
studySnapshot.keyFinding: ~80% of users scan pages rather than reading word-by-word
studySnapshot.soWhatForResumes: Your resume structure matters as much as the content itself

figures.title: F-Pattern scanning behavior
figures.caption: Eye-tracking reveals the F-pattern: horizontal sweep at top, shorter sweep below, vertical scan down the left edge.

keyInsights.title: The F-shaped pattern dominates
keyInsights.explanation: Eyes sweep horizontally at top, then shorter horizontal sweep, then vertical scan down the left side.
keyInsights.riypImplication: We check that your most important info appears where F-pattern eyes land.

keyInsights.title: Eyes jump to anchors
keyInsights.explanation: The 'spotted pattern' shows eyes jumping to numbers, names, titles, and keywords.
keyInsights.riypImplication: Bullet Upgrades encourage leading with metrics and strong verbs.

keyInsights.title: Headings create layers
keyInsights.explanation: The 'layer cake pattern' shows eyes hopping from heading to heading, skimming content between.
keyInsights.riypImplication: We ensure your section headers are clear and distinct.

keyInsights.title: One idea per bullet wins
keyInsights.explanation: Multi-idea bullets get partially scanned; single-idea bullets get fully processed.
keyInsights.riypImplication: We flag compound bullets and suggest splitting them.

keyInsights.title: Numbers near the front get seen
keyInsights.explanation: Impact buried at the end of sentences often gets missed during scanning.
keyInsights.riypImplication: Bullet Upgrades move metrics toward the front of bullets.

keyInsights.title: Consistent alignment speeds scanning
keyInsights.explanation: Predictable layouts let eyes move faster with more confidence.
keyInsights.riypImplication: Our Readability score factors in formatting consistency.

riypChanges.why: we check that important content appears where scanning patterns predict attention.
we encourage leading with metrics and strong verbs to catch scanning eyes.
we factor in formatting consistency that supports predictable scanning.

sources.name: Nielsen Norman Group: How People Read Online

footnotes.title: How Users Read on the Web
footnotes.author: Nielsen Norman Group

limitations: Web scanning patterns may differ from paper document scanning
